intro: Oreocharis ninglangensis, commonly known as the Ninglang oreocharis, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, showy flowers that resemble miniature orchids. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions with high humidity and cool temperatures. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a rosette pattern, and it produces small, greenish-white blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
